question: This system of Medicine is one of the ancient systems of medicine in India having its roots attached to Dravidian culture. Under this system, diagnosis of diseases is done through examination of pulse, urine, eyes, study of voice, colour of body, tongue and status of the digestion of individual patients. This system has a unique treasure for the conversion of metals and minerals as drugs. Which of the following systems of Medicine has been described above?
explanation: Siddha system of Medicine is one of the ancient systems of medicine in India having its roots attached with Dravidian culture. It emphasizes on the patient, environment, age, sex, race, habits, mental frame work, habitat, diet, appetite, physical condition, physiological constitution of the diseases for its treatment which is individualistic in nature. Diagnosis of diseases are done through examination of pulse, urine, eyes, study of voice, colour of body, tongue and status of the digestion of individual patients. This system has unique treasure for the conversion of metals and minerals as drugs and many infective diseases are treated with the medicines containing specially processed mercury, silver, arsenic, lead and sulphur without any side effect.
